job.title: Data Scientist, Computational Biology & Baseline Health Study
job.description: Verily an Alphabet company lives at the intersection of technology data science and healthcare Our mission is to make the worlds health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier livesbrbrOur team combines expertise in healthcare data science and technology to improve the health and wellbeing of our communities We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good Our datadriven solutions span three primary areas research care and innovation Programs include Project Baseline  our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research Onduo  our personalized virtual care platform which includes connected tools lifestyle coaching and clinical support and Debug  our effort to reduce the threat of mosquitoborne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique Were also actively working to combat the spread of COVID19 through new programs like Healthy at WorkbrbrstronguDescriptionbrbrustrongAs a Data Scientist working on computational biology you will be joining a team making use of diverse omics data to improve biomarker and target discovery in different disease settings You will work in a collaborative crossfunctional team to apply molecular platforms in clinical and research settings You will lead analyses of large diseasefocused datasets to develop new hypotheses about complex disease and develop an analytical story supporting these hypotheses You will also work with internal and external collaborators to design new studies in which to apply these molecular platforms and analyses and may also develop new methods and models to help derive insights from our proprietary platformsbrbrstronguResponsibilitiesbrustrongulliOversee molecular data processing and data delivery for the Baseline Health StudyliliDesign translational research studies using molecular dataliliAnalyze complex omics and multiomics data sets in combination with clinical and other dataliliBuild and evaluate predictive models of diseaseriskliliCommunicate technical results to internal and external crossfunctional teamsbrliulstronguQualificationsbrbrustrongMinimum QualificationsbrulliAdvanced degree in a quantitative discipline Computational Biology Bioinformatics Statistics Computer Science or related or equivalent practical experienceliliProficient in Python andor RliliExpertise in statistical data analysis modeling machine learning and exploratory data analysisliliDemonstrated track record of analyzing large biological data sets in translational research settingsbrliulstronguPreferred Qualificationsbrustrongulli1 years industry experienceliliExperience working with clinical study data in any disease settingliliExperience working with proteomics dataliliOutstanding oral and written communication and teamworkliliDesire to work closely with crossfunctional collaborators to help drive the team to resultsliul
